intro: Galium palaeoitalicum, commonly known as the ancient Italian bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Galium palaeoitalicum is notable for its historical use in traditional medicine and as a source of herbal remedies.
